com.sterlingcommerce.activity

Interface ISCActivityTrackingProvider

  • All Superinterfaces:
    ISCActivityTrackingInterceptor

    public interface ISCActivityTrackingProvider
extends ISCActivityTrackingInterceptor
    Activity tracking provider must implement this interface. There can only be one tracking provider. A provider acts as the controller to activity tracking. asmishra

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void cleanWorkerThreadLocal()
      Since each worker runs in a different thread, this method should be called for provider to cleanup thread local.
      int getBatchSize()
      Returns the batch size in which actual raise events are processed.
      int getMaxDelay()
      Returns the maximum allowed delay (in seconds) in batch processing.
      int getWarningTriggerCount()
      Returns the number of raise events in a batch at which an warning should be given.
      boolean isActivityTrackingEnabled()
      Returns true if activity tracking is enabled.
      boolean isActivityTrackingEnabled(java.lang.String eventId)
      Returns true if activity tracking is enabled for given event id.
      boolean isActivityTrackingEnabled(java.lang.String eventId, javax.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest request)
      Returns true if activity tracking is enabled for given event id.
      void processWorkerThreadLocal()
      Since each worker runs in a different thread, this method should be called to provide thread local access to the provider.

      • getBatchSize

        int getBatchSize()
        Returns the batch size in which actual raise events are processed. If this method returns 1, all raise events should be processed immediately; and if it returns negative or zero value, batch processing should depend only on maximum delay. the size of the batch #getMaxDelay()

      • getMaxDelay

        int getMaxDelay()
        Returns the maximum allowed delay (in seconds) in batch processing. If this method returns 0, all raise events should be processed immediately; and if it returns negative integer, batch processing depends only on batch size. maximum allowed delay (in seconds) in batch processing #getBatchSize()

      • getWarningTriggerCount

        int getWarningTriggerCount()
        Returns the number of raise events in a batch at which an warning should be given. If this method returns 0, warning is disabled. the number of raise events in a batch at which an warning should be given

      • processWorkerThreadLocal

        void processWorkerThreadLocal()
        Since each worker runs in a different thread, this method should be called to provide thread local access to the provider.

      • cleanWorkerThreadLocal

        void cleanWorkerThreadLocal()
        Since each worker runs in a different thread, this method should be called for provider to cleanup thread local.
